text: hello this bill Cunningham from the
throngs of Easter Sunday on Fifth Avenue
and the famed Easter Parade the Easter
Parade started out as an after church
service promenade by people who lived on
Fifth Avenue or close by because that
was in the 1880s it is evolved into
something quite different but it's
absolutely wonderful and fun to see and
many of the themes of dress are repeated
from year to year I was looking back in
my files to my earliest ones in the 50s
and the popularity of people dressing in
top hats and the look of the 1890s or
the Edwardian dandies or the fancies of
the 1920s in 30s and then of course you
have the children who people just love
dressing up their children and their
pets it's wonderful it just encompasses
all segments of society well this year
instead of covering the traditional hats
and all of that what I saw one thing in
the Easter Parade that I was bowled over
and they were a group of they must have
been 30 of them and they are attendants
of a Brooklyn odd school at any rate
they all took conventional men's jackets
and did it themselves putting cloth
flowers off either as trimming covering
the whole jacket you'll see them here as
the border what a marvelous idea for
someone in the fashion world to develop
for a spring jacket for Floyd weddings
of special occasions I mean here was an
idea Bhavan in the rough but to take
this idea and develop it in the fashion
world hey maybe that's what we need to
get out of the doldrums Buffalo big
cutter look of fashion today
